x1 steel armor (1d8+1 levels of Decay)
x1 laser rifle (1d6+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Electrically Charged. When a Lost attacks a target and deals damage with any weapon, the attack deals an additional 1d6 electricity damage. Additionally, when a Lost takes electricity damage, the damage is converted into SP, up to half its Healing Rate (8).
Electric Discharge. When killed, a Lost releases an electrical explosion with a radius of 10 ft.. Any creature in the radius takes 1d8 electricity damage.
Vault Suit. The Pip-Boy’s integration with the Engineer’s Vault Suit allows them to heal an additional amount of HP equal to their level (12) when healing.
actions: 5 AP Laser Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 105/215 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2 + Burning. Hit: 10 (2d6+4) laser damage. Reload every 24 attacks (4 AP).

5 AP Ripper. (makes 5 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., up to 5 targets within reach. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) slashing. Reload every 2 attacks. Depleted: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage. If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target takes 1 level of Bleeding.

Lost Champion.name: Lost Champion
Lost Champion.description: The former vault dwellers of Vault 63 in Appalachia’s Shenandoah Valley, turned into feral monsters through a unique mutation connected to the storm. Driven insane by an electrical hivemind, they are actively hostile to any without their mutation.
loot: x1 X-01 power armor (6 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma caster (1d8 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma cutter (1d8+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Power Armored. The Champion has X-01 Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points (25). When the Destroyer takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Prototype. When the Champion’s X-01 Power Armor gains a level of Decay, it gains twice as many.

Electrically Charged. When a Lost attacks a target and deals damage with any weapon, the attack deals an additional 1d6 electricity damage. Additionally, when a Lost takes electricity damage, the damage is converted into SP, up to half its Healing Rate (6).
Electric Discharge. When killed, a Lost releases an electrical explosion with a radius of 10 ft.. Any creature in the radius takes 1d8 electricity damage.
Vault Suit. The Pip-Boy’s integration with the Champion’s Vault Suit allows them to heal an additional amount of HP equal to their level (20) when healing.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Caster. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 135/180 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 20/1d12. Hit: 16 (2d12+4) plasma damage. Reload every 30 attacks. Attacks beyond 135 ft. will target 2 additional creatures or objects within 5 ft. of the initial target with the same attack roll, dealing 6 (1d12) damage.

5 AP Plasma Cutter. Melee weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/Severe limb condition. Hit: 23 (4d8+7) plasma damage. Reload every 5 attacks. Depleted: 10 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage.

Scrapper.name: Scrapper
Scrapper.description: Descendents of destitute locals inhabiting the rural swamplands of pre-war America. They often suffer from deformities, though whether they’re caused by radiation or a shallow gene pool is anyone’s guess.
loot: x1 hunting rifle (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
x1 baseball bat (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
traits: Stealthy. Scrappers have advantage on Sneak skill checks when hiding.
Diseased. When a Scrapper damages a target’s HP with a Melee or Unarmed attack, the target must make a Disease check.
actions: 6 AP Hunting Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +0 to hit, range 20/50 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d8. Hit: 11 (2d8+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 5 attacks.
5 AP Baseball Bat. Melee weapon attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/2d4 + push back 5 ft. Hit: 7 (3d4-1) bludgeoning damage.

Brawler.name: Brawler
Brawler.description: Descendents of destitute locals inhabiting the rural swamplands of pre-war America. They often suffer from deformities, though whether they’re caused by radiation or a shallow gene pool is anyone’s guess.
loot: x1 double barrel shotgun (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Diseased. When a Brawler damages a target’s HP with a Melee or Unarmed attack, the target must make a Disease check.
actions: 4 AP Double Barrel Shotgun. Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 20/45 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/3d10. Hit: 11 (2d10+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 2 attacks (1 AP per shell, 2 AP total). Attacks beyond 20 ft. will target 2 additional creatures or objects within 5 ft. of the initial target with the same attack roll, dealing 5 (1d10) damage.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.

Bruiser.name: Bruiser
Bruiser.description: Descendents of destitute locals inhabiting the rural swamplands of pre-war America. They often suffer from deformities, though whether they’re caused by radiation or a shallow gene pool is anyone’s guess.
loot: x1 fire axe (1d6+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Diseased. When a Bruiser damages a target’s HP with a Melee or Unarmed attack, the target must make a Disease check.
Charger. For every 10 ft. the Bruiser moves on their turn, they gain +1 DT until the start of their next turn.
actions: 6 AP Fire Axe. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 15 (2d10+5) slashing damage. With +3 AP, this attack additionally hits two spaces adjacent to the target.
3 AP Punch. Unarmed attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2 + knocked back 5 ft.. Hit: 14 (3d6+5) bludgeoning damage.

Enclave Engineer.name: Enclave Engineer
Enclave Engineer.description: Engineers are the low level maintenance workers of the Enclave, and often have little to do with the Enclave’s actual goals. They exist to keep the gears spinning, and don’t pause to think about what the machine is doing.
traits: Mechanic. Engineers ignore 1 DT against Robotic enemies.
actions: 4 AP Wrench. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/4d4. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) bludgeoning damage.

Enclave Scientist.name: Enclave Scientist
Enclave Scientist.description: Scientists in the Enclave work with top-of-the-line equipment to develop new technology to advance the Enclave’s goals. They spend most of their time in the lab, and aren’t trained for combat.
loot: x1 laser pistol (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Anatomical Knowledge. Scientists have +1 to damage rolls against mutated enemies (ghouls, super mutants, creatures, etc.).
Cowardly. If there are no Enclave Soldiers or Officers on the field, Scientists gain the Frightened condition and try to Flee.
Environmental Suit. Enclave Scientists are immune to airborne chemical hazards like Toxic Air and radiation damage.
actions: 5 AP Laser Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2 + Burning. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) laser damage. Reload every 30 attacks (4 AP). If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
4 AP Stimpak. The Scientist uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (5 HP).
4 AP Mentats. The Scientist consumes 1 Mentats. They gain 1 AP at the start of next turn and have advantage on all Intelligence and Perception ability and skill checks for 1 hour.

Enclave Pilot.name: Enclave Pilot
Enclave Pilot.description: Pilots serve to bolster the Enclave’s main force with vertibird fire support. Enclave Pilots are the most highly trained and skilled pilots in the wasteland, capable of performing advanced vertibird maneuvers.
loot: x1 fitted (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) leather armor (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma defender (1d6+1 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Pilots gain +1 AC.
Expert Pilot. When Pilots make Intelligence ability checks to maintain control over a Vertibird, their rolls are increased by +4 and they have advantage.
Fitted Armor. Whenever a Pilot takes damage from an Area of Effect attack, the damage is reduced by 2.
actions: 4 AP Plasma Defender. Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 50/90 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 14 (2d10+4) plasma damage. Reload every 16 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 15/45 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 5 (2d4+1) piercing/slashing damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Pilot uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (9 HP).

Enclave Officer.name: Enclave Officer
Enclave Officer.description: Officers are the field commanders of the Enclave, leading individual units and camps. They keep their men in line with an authoritative iron fist, which can often breed resentment in the troops below them.
Enclave Officer.skills: Energy Weapons +6, Melee Weapons +4, Intimidation +2, Explosives +2
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma pistol (1d6 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Officers gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 45/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 12 (2d8+4) plasma damage. Reload every 16 attacks.

5 AP Ripper. (makes 5 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., up to 5 targets within reach. Hit: 3 (1d6) slashing damage. Reload every 2 attacks. Depleted: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage. If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target takes 1 level of Bleeding.
4 AP Plasma Grenade. Thrown Explosive: +2 to roll, range 50 ft., 10 ft. radius. All creatures within 10 ft. take 16 (4d8) plasma damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Officer uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (11 HP).

Enclave Soldier (Combat Armor).name: Enclave Soldier (Combat Armor)
Enclave Soldier (Combat Armor).description: Soldiers make up the main fighting force of the Enclave. Highly trained and very well equipped with advanced technology. These soldiers are equipped with top-of-the-line combat armor.
loot: x1 ballistic weave armor (1d4+1 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma rifle (1d6-1 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Soldiers gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 70/105 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 10 (2d8+2) plasma damage. Reload every 12 attacks.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/55 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.
4 AP Plasma Grenade. Thrown Explosive: +3 to roll, range 70 ft., 10 ft. radius. All creatures within 10 ft. take 16 (4d8) plasma damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Soldier uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (10 HP).

Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK1).name: Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK1)
Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK1).description: Soldiers make up the main fighting force of the Enclave. Highly trained and very well equipped with advanced technology. These soldiers are equipped with APA MK1 Power Armor, often seen on the West Coast.
Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK1).skills: Energy Weapons +8, Guns +5, Intimidation +6, Melee Weapons +6
loot: x1 plasma rifle (1d6-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Soldiers gain +1 AC.

Power Armored. The Soldier has APA MK1 Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points (30). When the Soldier takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Intimidating. The Soldier has disadvantage on Charisma ability and skill checks except for Intimidation skill checks, which they have advantage on.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 70/105 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 12 (2d8+1) plasma damage. Reload every 12 attacks.
0 AP Auto-Inject Stimpak. Used when HP is 34 or lower. The Soldier consumes an Auto-Inject Stimpak and regains HP equal to their Healing Rate (13 HP).

Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK2).name: Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK2)
Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK2).description: Soldiers make up the main fighting force of the Enclave. Highly trained and very well equipped with advanced technology. These soldiers are equipped with APA MK2 Power Armor, often seen on the East Coast.
Enclave Soldier (Power Armor, APA MK2).skills: Energy Weapons +8, Guns +5, Intimidation +6, Melee Weapons +6
loot: x1 plasma rifle (1d6-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Soldiers gain +1 AC.

Power Armored. The Soldier has APA MK2 Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points (32). When the Soldier takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Intimidating. The Soldier has disadvantage on Charisma ability and skill checks except for Intimidation skill checks, which they have advantage on.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 70/105 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 12 (2d8+1) plasma damage. Reload every 12 attacks.
0 AP Auto-Inject Stimpak. Used when HP is 34 or lower. The Soldier consumes an Auto-Inject Stimpak and regains HP equal to their Healing Rate (13 HP).

Enclave Soldier (Hellfire).name: Enclave Soldier (Hellfire)
Enclave Soldier (Hellfire).description: Hellfire Soldiers are a specialized type of soldier wearing the advanced Hellfire Power Armor. They often fulfill support roles, laying down suppressing fire, literally, with their advanced incinerators.
Enclave Soldier (Hellfire).skills: Energy Weapons +8, Guns +5, Intimidation +6, Melee Weapons +6
loot: x1 heavy incinerator (1d6+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Enclave members, Soldiers gain +1 AC.

Power Armored. The Soldier has Hellfire Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points (35). When the Soldier takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Intimidating. The Soldier has disadvantage on Charisma ability and skill checks except for Intimidation skill checks, which they have advantage on.
actions: 6 AP Heavy Incinerator. Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 70/105 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/2d10 fire damage to the target and any creature within 5 ft. of the target. Hit: 19 (3d12+1) fire damage. Reload every 24 attacks (10 AP).

5 AP Ripper. (makes 5 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., up to 5 targets within reach. Hit: 10 (1d6+7) slashing damage. Reload every 2 attacks. Depleted: 9 (1d4+7) bludgeoning damage. If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target takes 1 level of Bleeding.
1 AP Stimpak. The Soldier uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (15 HP).

Secret Service Agent.name: Secret Service Agent
Secret Service Agent.description: The Secret Service protects high value personnel in the Enclave, such as the President or high ranking officers. Extremely well trained and disciplined, these Agents rarely fail their duty.
Secret Service Agent.skills: Energy Weapons +10, Sneak +8, Intimidation +12, Melee Weapons +8
traits: Bodyguard. When an enemy makes an attack against the Secret Service Agent’s protection target, the Secret Service Agent can use their reaction to move up to 10 ft. towards the attacker. Additionally, the Secret Service Agent is immune to the Frightened condition as long as they are guarding their protection target.
actions: 5 AP Tri-Beam Laser Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/5d6 + Burning. Hit: 14 (3d6+5) laser damage. Reload every 8 attacks (4 AP). Attacks beyond 40 ft. will target 3 additional creatures or objects within 5 ft. of the initial target with the same attack roll, dealing 6 (2d6) damage. Using the On-Board Tracking upgrade, the Secret Service Agent can use 6 AP to mark a creature within 40 ft., giving advantage on attack rolls against that creature. Only one creature can be marked at a time.

4 AP Plasma Defender. Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 60/100 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3. Hit: 15 (2d10+5) plasma damage. Reload every 16 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/60 ft.. Crit chance 19/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 7 (2d4+3) piercing/slashing damage.

5 AP Flash Bang. Thrown explosive roll: +8 to roll, range 80 ft., radius 20 ft.. All creatures within 20 ft. take 1 explosive damage, gain the Blinding and Deafened conditions for 4 - END modifier rounds, and gain 2 levels of Fatigue.
4 AP Stimpak. The Secret Service Agent uses the stimpak on themselves or another creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (17).
3 AP Stealth Boy. The Secret Service Agent uses a Stealth Boy and becomes Invisible for 1 minute (10 rounds).
4 AP Calmex. The Secret Service Agent takes a hit of Calmex, increasing their Passive Sense by 5 and adding an additional +10 damage to their critical hits.

NCR Trooper.name: NCR Trooper
NCR Trooper.description: Troopers are primarily volunteers or conscripts that make up the foundation of the NCR Army. Poorly trained and ill equipped, these troopers have little in the way of experience and even less in the way of morale.
loot: x1 leather armor (1d4+2 levels of decay)
x1 service rifle (1d6+2 levels of decay)
actions: 5 AP Service Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 40/95 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/2d6. Hit: 6 (2d6) ballistic damage. Reload every 20 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
5 AP 9mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 45/70 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 3 (1d6) ballistic damage. Reload every 13 attacks.

5 AP Frag Grenade. Thrown Explosive: +2 to roll, range 50 ft., 5/20 ft. radius. All creatures within 5 ft. take 12 (4d6) explosive damage and gain 2 random leg conditions. All creatures within 10 ft. gain the Deafened condition for 4 - END modifier rounds. All creatures within 20 ft. take half damage.

NCR Scout.name: NCR Scout
NCR Scout.description: Scouts serve as a support role for the NCR Army, gathering intel on the environment or enemy movements ahead of the main force. Not much of a threat on their own, but if they’re watching, the NCR is coming.
loot: x1 light (rank 1) leather armor (1d4+2 levels of decay)
actions: 5 AP 9mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 60/95 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 3 (1d6) ballistic damage. Reload every 13 attacks.

4 AP Flare Gun. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d4. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) fire damage. Reload every attack (4 AP). If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target gains the Burning condition.
4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d6) slashing damage.

NCR Military Police.name: NCR Military Police
NCR Military Police.description: The Military Police keep order and law within NCR camps, punishing any troopers who break the code of conduct. Depending on where you’re stationed, this can mean being thrown in a cell, or being executed.
loot: x1 leather armor (1d4+2 levels of decay)
x1 cattle prod (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Stop Resisting. NCR MPs will always attempt to non-lethally deal with enemies by knocking them out with a cattle prod and detaining them with handcuffs, however if an enemy is either not a human or is a clear and immediate severe threat, they will go for the kill.
actions: 5 AP 10mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 60/125 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/1d4. Hit: 4 (2d4) ballistic damage. Reload every 12 attacks.

4 AP Cattle Prod. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/Dazed. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning and 8 (2d8) electricity damage. Reload every 10 attacks. Depleted: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning. If this attack damages a creature’s HP, the creature gains a level of Fatigue.
4 AP Stimpak. The NCR MP uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (7).

6 AP Handcuff. The NCR MP tries to handcuff a creature within 5 ft.. The creature must make a contested Strength ability check against the NCR MP, and if they fail, they are handcuffed. If the creature is Prone or Restrained, they have disadvantage. If the creature is unconscious or incapacitated, they automatically fail the contested check.

NCR Field Medic.name: NCR Field Medic
NCR Field Medic.description: Field Medics work tirelessly to keep troopers alive during combat encounters. Distinguished by a red cross armband and the large amount of medical supplies they’re carrying.
loot: x1 leather armor (1d8 levels of decay)
traits: First Aid. NCR Field Medics gain a +2 bonus to all healing. Additionally, they can spend 1 hour to heal a creature up to half their max HP and remove up to 2 levels of Radiation.
actions: 5 AP 9mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +2 to hit, range 60/95 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 13 attacks.
4 AP Stimpak. The Field Medic uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate + 2 (7).
4 AP Med-X. The Field Medic uses Med-X on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They gain +3 DT.
6 AP First Aid Kit. The Field Medic uses a First Aid Kit on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They immediately remove 2 levels of Bleeding or restore a Dying creature to 1 HP.

NCR Shocktrooper.name: NCR Shocktrooper
NCR Shocktrooper.description: Shocktroopers are a specialized rank designed to break through enemy defenses. They accomplish this with crude steel armor and a dose of Psycho, creating a fast and terrifying force on the battlefield.
loot: x1 hardened (rank 1) steel armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 .45 auto pistol (1d6+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Shock Troops. While under the effects of Psycho, a Shocktrooper cannot be talked down from violence. They are immune to any Charisma-based ability to pacify them and have advantage on any rolls to resist becoming Frightened while under the effects of Psycho.
actions: 4 AP .45 Auto Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 30/45 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 9 (1d10+4) ballistic damage. Reload every 7 attacks (4 AP). If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
4 AP Hatchet. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 30/60 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 7 (2d4+3) slashing damage.

4 AP Psycho. The Shocktrooper takes a hit of Psycho, consuming the item. They gain +3 DT and +5 to all damage rolls, however they must always attack the nearest hostile creature on their turn. If they cannot see any hostile creatures on their turn, they must make a DC 15 Endurance ability check or they must attack an ally.

NCR Flametrooper.name: NCR Flametrooper
NCR Flametrooper.description: Flametroopers are a specialized unit equipped with a flamer and gas mask, designed to flush out enemy combatants with a flood of fire. Often a high value target for the enemy side.
loot: x1 asbestos-lined (rank 2) leather armor (1d6 levels of Decay)
traits: Gas Mask. Flametroopers are immune to airborne chemical hazards like Toxic Air as long as they are wearing their gas mask.

Exposed Tanks. If a Flametrooper takes damage to their HP from a Targeted Attack to the Torso, the attacker can make a DC 14 Luck ability check. On a success, the flamer tank ruptures and explodes. This explosion deals 4d12 explosion damage with a radius of 15 ft., and any creature inside the radius is set on fire.
actions: 6 AP Flamer. Area of Effect attack. Range 60 ft. line, 10 ft. wide / 20 ft. cone. All creatures in the area take 10 (2d10) fire damage and gain the Burning condition. Additionally, the targeted area is set on fire. Reload every 5 attacks (10 AP, 1 canister).

6 AP 9mm SMG. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 15/30 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 19/1d4. Hit: 2 (1d4) ballistic damage. Reload every 10 attacks.

NCR Pilot.name: NCR Pilot
NCR Pilot.description: Pilots are responsible for the precious few vertibirds in the NCR’s small fleet. They are largely regulated to support and transport roles, and rarely see combat due to the scarcity of vertibirds as a resource.
loot: x1 fitted (rank 1) leather armor (1d6 levels of Decay)
x1 flare gun (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Experienced Pilot. When Pilots make Intelligence ability checks to maintain control over a Vertibird, their rolls are increased by +2.
Fitted Armor. Whenever a Pilot takes damage from an Area of Effect attack, the damage is reduced by 2.
actions: 5 AP 9mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 60/95 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 13 attacks.

4 AP Flare Gun. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d4. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) fire damage. Reload every attack (4 AP). If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target gains the Burning condition.

NCR Heavy Trooper.name: NCR Heavy Trooper
NCR Heavy Trooper.description: Heavy Troopers are elite soldiers in the NCR Army, equipped with salvaged suits of power armor that have had the mechanized frame stripped out. They often serve as bodyguards for important officers.
loot: x1 strengthened (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) steel armor (1d4+2 levels of decay)
x1 light machine gun (1d4+2 levels of decay)
x1 super sledge (1d6+3 levels of Decay)
traits: Heavy Armor. Heavy Troopers can only move a maximum of 20 ft. on their turn.
actions: 6 AP Light Machine Gun. (makes 5 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 20/70 ft., up to 5 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 20/1d12. Hit: 5 (1d12-1) ballistic damage. Reload every 20 attacks.

6 AP Super Sledge. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/3d12 + Dazed. Hit: 23 (3d12+5) bludgeoning damage. With +3 AP, this attack additionally hits two spaces adjacent to the target.

NCR First Recon Sniper.name: NCR First Recon Sniper
NCR First Recon Sniper.description: First Recon is the most skilled sniper unit in the NCR Army, serving as reconnaissance and support for the main troopers. Written on their signature red berets is their motto - “The last thing you never see”.
loot: x1 camouflaged (rank 1) leather armor (1d6-1 level of decay)
x1 scoped .308 hunting rifle (1d4+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Sharpshooter. First Recon Snipers do not have disadvantage when attacking a target beyond their weapon’s short range, as long as the weapon is a scoped rifle.
Camouflaged. The First Recon Sniper has advantage on Sneak skill checks relying on sight.
actions: 6 AP Hunting Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 140/340 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/1d10. Hit: 13 (2d10+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 5 attacks. Attacks within 50 ft. have disadvantage.
4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 4 (2d6+1) slashing damage.

4 AP Steady. The First Recon Sniper takes a hit of Steady, consuming the item. Their Passive Sense is increased by 5, their critical hits deal +10 damage, and they have advantage on Combat Sequence rolls, rolls to resist becoming Frightened, and Charisma ability and skill checks.

NCR Officer.name: NCR Officer
NCR Officer.description: Officers serve as the primary leadership role in the NCR Army, commanding anything from small squads to entire battalions depending on their rank. The higher ranked officers typically wear green berets.
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 1) leather armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Field Commander. Any NCR soldiers within 60 ft. of the Officer gain +1 AC and have advantage on checks to resist becoming Frightened.
actions: 5 AP 10mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 60/125 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/1d4. Hit: 5 (2d4+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 12 attacks.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 15/35 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 5 (2d4+1) piercing/slashing damage.

NCR Ranger.name: NCR Ranger
NCR Ranger.description: Rangers are a specialized subset of the NCR Army, requiring intensive training to make it through the program. The Rangers are independent to the main Army, though often provide support to the troopers.
loot: x1 sturdy (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) leather armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 trail carbine (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Survival Expert. Rangers have advantage on Perception ability and Survival skill checks.
actions: 6 AP Trail Carbine. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 60/140 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 10 (2d8+2) ballistic damage. Reload every 8 attacks (1 AP per round, 8 AP total).
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/40 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Ranger Takedown. The Ranger knocks down a target within 5 ft. of them by sweeping the legs. The target gets knocked Prone.

NCR Veteran Ranger.name: NCR Veteran Ranger
NCR Veteran Ranger.description: Veteran Rangers are the elite of the elite, the most skilled and most dangerous force in the NCR. They wear a distinctive set of black riot armor and duster. Their appearance strikes fear in even the NCR Troopers.
NCR Veteran Ranger.skills: Guns +10, Melee Weapons +8, Survival +8, Sneak +8, Intimidation +10
loot: x1 sturdy (rank 1) ballistic weave armor (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
x1 brush gun (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 hunting revolver (1d6-1 levels of Decay)
x1 night vision goggles (1d8+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Survival Expert. Rangers have advantage on Perception ability and Survival skill checks.
Hardy. Veteran Rangers have advantage on Death Save rolls.
Gas Mask. Veteran Rangers are immune to airborne chemical hazards like Toxic Air as long as they are wearing their gas mask.
actions: 6 AP Brush Gun. Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 70/160 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x2. Hit: 20 (3d10+5) ballistic damage. Reload every 6 attacks (1 AP per round, 6 AP total).
6 AP Hunting Revolver. Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 50/140 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3. Hit: 20 (3d10+5) ballistic damage. Reload every 5 attacks (1 AP per round, 5 AP total).
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/40 ft.. Crit chance 19/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Veteran Ranger uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (14 HP).
6 AP Ranger Takedown. The Ranger knocks down a target within 5 ft. of them by sweeping the legs. The target gets knocked Prone.

Recruit Legionary.name: Recruit Legionary
Recruit Legionary.description: Recruit Legionaries are the basic soldiers in Caesar’s Legion. Though inexperienced, they are highly trained and disciplined, with the same zealous devotion to Caesar shared by all Legionaries.
loot: x1 hardened (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4+3 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Recruit Legionary, they have advantage on checks against becoming Frightened.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 9 (2d6+3) slashing damage.
5 AP 9mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 40/65 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 13 attacks.
4 AP Spear. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. If thrown, range 45/80 ft.. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Legionary consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (3 HP).

Prime Legionary.name: Prime Legionary
Prime Legionary.description: Prime Legionaries have proven themselves on the battlefield to be capable warriors. Primes tend to be tasked with missions that require more experience, such as guarding important camps or coordinated raids.
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 1) and hardened (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4+1 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Prime Legionary, they have advantage on checks against becoming Frightened.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 9 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

6 AP 9mm SMG. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 25/55 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 20/1d4. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 10 attacks.
4 AP Spear. Melee weapon attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. If thrown, range 45/80 ft.. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Legionary consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (4 HP).

Veteran Legionary.name: Veteran Legionary
Veteran Legionary.description: Veteran Legionaries are the elite of Caesar’s Legion, highly experienced from years of service in the harshest of conditions. They are sent out on missions vital to the Legion’s goals.
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
x1 hunting rifle (1d4+2 levels of decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Veteran Legionary, they have advantage on checks against becoming Frightened.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 10 (2d6+4) slashing damage.
6 AP Hunting Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 45/125 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/1d8. Hit: 12 (2d8+4) ballistic damage. Reload every 5 attacks.
4 AP Spear. Melee weapon attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. If thrown, range 50/90 ft.. Crit chance 19/x2. Hit: 9 (1d10+4) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Legionary consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (6 HP).

Legionary Explorer.name: Legionary Explorer
Legionary Explorer.description: Explorers serve as the reconnaissance units in the Legion. Quietly tracking and observing the enemy through the roughest of terrain, the Explorers tend to avoid direct combat but can still hold their own in a fight.
loot: x1 light (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Legionary Explorer, they have advantage on checks against becoming Frightened.
Hard Travels. Legionary Explorers ignore the negative effects of Difficult Terrain.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 8 (2d6+2) slashing damage.
4 AP Spear. Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. If thrown, range 40/70 ft.. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Legionary consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (3 HP).

Legionary Vexillarius.name: Legionary Vexillarius
Legionary Vexillarius.description: Vexillarius are the flag bearers of the Legion, providing a rallying point for the legionaries. They tend to be better armored and equipped, but are rarely seen on the front lines outside of major battles.
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 2) cloth armor (1d4+2 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Legionary Vexillarius, they cannot be Frightened.

Flag-Bearer. When any other Legionary can see the Vexillarius, they gain +1d6 to all attack rolls. If the Vexillarius is killed, all Legionaries who see them fall will lose the Caesar’s Devoted feature and must make a DC 12 Endurance ability check or gain the Frightened condition for 1 turn.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 9 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

6 AP 10mm SMG. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 35/70 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 19/1d6. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 10 attacks.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Vexillarius consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (4 HP).

Decanus.name: Decanus
Decanus.description: A Decanus is the officer of Caesar’s Legion, distinguished by their feathered helmets. Depending on their rank and experience, a Decanus can command groups ranging from small units to entire camps.
Decanus.skills: Melee Weapons +8, Guns +6, Unarmed +8, Speech +8, Intimidation +6
loot: x1 lever action rifle (1d4+3 levels of decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Decanus, they cannot be Frightened.
Field Commander. Any Legionaries within 60 ft. of the Decanus gain +1 AC.
actions: 4 AP Machete. Melee weapon attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3 + 2 levels of Bleeding. Hit: 9 (2d6+3) slashing damage.
5 AP Lever Action Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 35/105 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 9 (2d6+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 10 attacks (1 AP per round, 10 AP total).
4 AP Spear. Melee weapon attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. If thrown, range 45/80 ft.. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing/slashing damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Decanus consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (4 HP).

Centurion.name: Centurion
Centurion.description: Centurions are the battlefield commanders of Caesar’s Legion. Every Centurion wears a unique set of armor, crafted from pieces of fallen foes. They are the strongest and most experienced in Caesar’s Legion.
loot: x1 handmade assault rifle (1d6+2 levels of decay)
x1 steel bumper sword (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Centurions can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Elite. Any Legionaries within 60 ft. of the Centurion gain +1 AC and deal +2 damage.
Strengthened Armor. When a Centurion takes damage to their HP from a critical hit, the damage is reduced by 5.
actions: 7 AP Steel Bumper Sword. Melee weapon attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x3. Hit: 29 (8d6+5) slashing damage. This attack additionally hits two spaces adjacent to the target.

6 AP Handmade Assault Rifle. (makes 5 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +10 to hit, range 45/140 ft., up to 5 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 20/1d12. Hit: 10 (1d12+4) ballistic damage. Reload every 2 attacks (4 AP).
6 AP Healing Powder. The Centurion consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (7 HP).

Praetorian.name: Praetorian
Praetorian.description: Praetorians are the bodyguards of important figures in the Legion, such as legates or Caesar himself. They are highly devoted and extremely skilled at unarmed combat, wielding powerful Ballistic Fists.
loot: x1 reinforced (rank 1) & hardened (rank 1) cloth armor (1d4+1 levels of Decay)
x1 ballistic fist (1d6-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Physical Fitness. Legionaries can move 10 ft. for 1 AP.
Caesar’s Devoted. When at least one other Legionary is within 60 ft. of the Praetorian, they cannot be Frightened.

Bodyguard. When an enemy makes an attack against the Praetorian’s protection target, the Praetorian can use their reaction to move up to 10 ft. towards the attacker. This can only be done once per round.
actions: 5 AP Ballistic Fist. Unarmed attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/2d10. Hit: 9 (1d10+4) bludgeoning and 17 (2d12+5) ballistic damage. Reload every 2 attacks. Depleted: 9 (1d10+4) bludgeoning damage.
6 AP Healing Powder. The Legionary consumes a Healing Powder. For the next 3 turns, they heal a number of HP equal to half their Healing Rate (7 HP).
6 AP Legion Takedown. Unarmed attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/2d4. Hit: 6 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked back 5 ft..

Gunner Private.name: Gunner Private
Gunner Private.description: Privates are the basic unit of the Gunners. Most Privates are new conscripts, inexperienced and lacking in the discipline of the more senior Gunners. They’re poorly equipped, often only wearing military fatigues.
loot: x1 cloth armor (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Gunners, Gunner Privates gain +1 AC.
actions: 5 AP 10mm Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +4 to hit, range 45/95 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d4. Hit: 3 (2d4+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 12 attacks.

5 AP Frag Grenade. Thrown Explosive: +1 to roll, range 60 ft., 5/20 ft. radius. All creatures within 5 ft. take 12 (4d6) explosive damage and gain 2 random leg conditions. All creatures within 10 ft. gain the Deafened condition for 4 - END modifier rounds. All creatures within 20 ft. take half damage.

Gunner Sergeant.name: Gunner Sergeant
Gunner Sergeant.description: Sergeants are the basic team commander for the Gunners, commanding small units in their duties. They lead their units with a strong military discipline.
loot: x1 leather armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 combat rifle (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d6 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Gunners, Gunner Sergeants gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Combat Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +5 to hit, range 60/140 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 9 (2d8+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 20 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/55 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.

4 AP Psycho. The Gunner takes a hit of Psycho, consuming the item. They gain +3 DT and +5 to all damage rolls, however they must always attack the nearest hostile creature on their turn. If they cannot see any hostile creatures on their turn, they must make a DC 15 Endurance ability check or they must attack an ally.

Gunner Commander.name: Gunner Commander
Gunner Commander.description: Commanders are high ranking Gunner leaders, commanding entire Gunner encampments or forts. They can often be found wearing salvaged power armor and wielding high power weaponry.
loot: x1 T-45 Power Armor (6 levels of Decay)
x1 heavy assault rifle (1d8 levels of Decay)
traits: Power Armored. The Gunner Commander has T-45 Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points. When the Gunner takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Clunky. The Gunner Commander has disadvantage on any Agility ability or skill checks, excluding attack rolls.
actions: 6 AP Heavy Assault Rifle. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 40/125 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft of each other. Crit chance 19/1d10. Hit: 6 (1d10+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 10 attacks.
6 AP Sledgehammer. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/3d12 + Dazed. Hit: 13 (1d12+7) bludgeoning damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Gunner Commander uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (10 HP).

Gunner Brigadier.name: Gunner Brigadier
Gunner Brigadier.description: Brigadiers are the highest level of commander in the Gunners, organizing many different companies at once from a central HQ. Well equipped, highly trained, and very experienced, they lead the Gunners with an iron fist.
loot: x1 ballistic weave armor (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
x1 plasma rifle (1d8 levels of decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
traits: Defensive Tactics. When within 10 ft. of other Gunners, Gunner Brigadiers gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Plasma Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 55/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x3. Hit: 11 (2d8+3) plasma damage. Reload every 12 attacks.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/60 ft.. Crit chance 19/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 7 (2d4+3) piercing/slashing damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Gunner Brigadier uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (14 HP).
3 AP Stealth Boy. The Gunner Brigadier uses a Stealth Boy and becomes Invisible for 1 minute (10 rounds).

Talon Company Mercenary.name: Talon Company Mercenary
Talon Company Mercenary.description: Talon Company Mercenaries are a feared foe against those who wish to better the wasteland. They are surprisingly well equipped, wearing black painted power armor and wielding military-grade weaponry.
loot: x1 ballistic weave armor (1d8 levels of Decay)
x1 combat shotgun (1d8 levels of Decay)
x1 police baton (1d4 levels of Decay)
actions: 4 AP Combat Shotgun. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 25/45 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/2d12. Hit: 14 (2d12+2) ballistic damage. Reload every 8 attacks. Attacks beyond 25 ft. will target 2 additional creatures or objects within 5 ft. of the initial target with the same attack roll, dealing 6 (1d12) damage.

4 AP Police Baton. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d6. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage. If this attack damages a creature’s HP, the creature gains a level of Fatigue.
4 AP Cigarette. The Mercenary smokes a cigarette. For the next hour, they have advantage on Charisma ability and skill checks, combat sequence rolls, and checks to resist becoming Frightened.
4 AP Stimpak. The Mercenary uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (8).

Talon Company Commander.name: Talon Company Commander
Talon Company Commander.description: Talon Company Commanders lead the mercenary company with cruel efficiency, striking as much fear in their own men as they do the wastelanders they hunt. No one knows how they’re so equipped or well trained.
loot: x1 ballistic weave armor (1d6 levels of Decay)
x1 urban assault rifle (1d8 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Field Commander. Any Talon Company Mercenaries within 60 ft. of the Commander gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Urban Assault Rifle. (makes 4 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 45/125 ft., up to 4 targets within 10 ft of each other. Crit chance 20/1d10. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) ballistic damage. Reload every 6 attacks (4 AP).
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/60 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 7 (2d4+3) piercing/slashing damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Commander uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (14).

Hellcat Company Mercenary.name: Hellcat Company Mercenary
Hellcat Company Mercenary.description: The Hellcat Company Mercenaries are a ruthless bunch, willing to work for anyone for the right fee. They are infamous for their reputation as a roving death squad working for the worst of the worst.
loot: x1 hardened (rank 1) leather armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
x1 combat rifle (1d6 levels of Decay)
x1 combat knife (1d6+2 levels of Decay)
traits: Professional. Hellcat Mercenaries have advantage on checks to resist becoming Frightened.
actions: 6 AP Combat Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +6 to hit, range 55/125 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2. Hit: 9 (2d8+1) ballistic damage. Reload every 20 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.
3 AP Combat Knife. Melee weapon attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. If thrown, range 20/55 ft.. Crit chance 20/x3 + Bleeding. Hit: 6 (2d4+2) piercing/slashing damage.

5 AP Frag Grenade. Thrown Explosive: +2 to roll, range 70 ft., 5/20 ft. radius. All creatures within 5 ft. take 12 (4d6) explosive damage and gain 2 random leg conditions. All creatures within 10 ft. gain the Deafened condition for 4 - END modifier rounds. All creatures within 20 ft. take half damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Mercenary uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (10 HP).

Hellcat Company Commander.name: Hellcat Company Commander
Hellcat Company Commander.description: Hellcat Company Commanders are rarely seen, but when they are, they are a force to be reckoned with. They are equipped with a set of prototype power armor rarely seen in the wastes.
loot: x1 X-01 Power Armor (2 levels of Decay)
x1 power fist (1d4 levels of Decay)
traits: Power Armored. The Hellcat Company Commander has X-01 Power Armor, and as such has Defense Points (25). When the Commander takes damage, it is first dealt to the DP. Once the DP reaches 0, its armor gains 1 level of Decay and the DP resets. Once it reaches 10 levels of Decay, the armor no longer blocks any damage.
Prototype. When the Hellcat Company Commander’s X-01 Power Armor gains a level of Decay, it gains twice as many.
Professional. Hellcat Mercenaries have advantage on checks to resist becoming Frightened.
Field Commander. Any Hellcat Company Mercenaries within 60 ft. of the Commander gain +1 AC.
actions: 6 AP Minigun. (makes 3 attacks, no damage modifier after first attack) Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 105/280 ft., up to 3 targets within 10 ft. of each other. Crit chance 19/2d6. Hit: 17 (5d6+2) ballistic damage. Reload every 12 attacks (10 AP). Attacks beyond 105 ft. will target 5 additional creatures or objects within 5 ft. of the initial target with the same attack roll, dealing 12 (4d6) damage.

4 AP Power Fist. Unarmed attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/x2 + Knockback 15 ft.. Hit: 19 (4d6+7) bludgeoning damage. Reload every 20 attacks. Depleted: 10 (1d6+7) bludgeoning damage.
4 AP Stimpak. The Commander uses a Stimpak on themselves or a creature within 5 ft. of them. They regain HP equal to their Healing Rate (15 HP).

Railroad Agent.name: Railroad Agent
Railroad Agent.description: Agents working for the Railroad prefer secrecy above all else, hiding in plain sight while gathering intel on potential Institute spies and runaway synths. If it comes down to it, they will fight to defend synths.
loot: x1 pipe pistol (1d8 levels of Decay)
actions: 6 AP Pipe Pistol. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 50/90 ft., one target. Crit chance 19/1d4. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) ballistic damage. Reload every 12 attacks. If they make 2 attacks in a row, they can make a 3rd attack for no AP cost.

5 AP Flash Bang. Thrown explosive roll: +8 to hit, range 40 ft., radius 20 ft.. All creatures within 20 ft. take 1 explosive damage, gain the Blinding and Deafened conditions for 4 - END modifier rounds, and gain 2 levels of Fatigue.

5 AP Smoke Grenade. Thrown explosive: +0 to roll, range 40 ft., radius 20 ft.. The area of effect becomes enveloped by smoke that lasts for 1 minute. The area is considered Heavily Obscured and any creatures in the area are Blinded.

Railroad Heavy.name: Railroad Heavy
Railroad Heavy.description: Heavies are the muscle of the Railroad, sent in when a situation has gone south or as protection for a risky synth transport. Equipped with the signature Railway Rifle and heavy steel armor, they will not go down easily.
loot: x1 railway rifle (1d4-1 levels of Decay)
x1 sturdy (rank 1) steel armor (1d6 levels of Decay)
traits: Defender. When defending Railroad Agents or Synths, Heavies gain +1 DT and are immune to the Frightened condition.
actions: 6 AP Railway Rifle. Ranged weapon attack: +8 to hit, range 25/55 ft., one target. Crit chance 17/x4. Hit: 12 (2d10+2) piercing damage. Reload every 10 attacks. If this attack damages a target’s HP, it ignores up to 8 DT. If the target is wearing Power Armor, it deals 8 additional damage to Defense Points.

5 AP Smoke Grenade. Thrown explosive: +0 to roll, range 40 ft., radius 20 ft.. The area of effect becomes enveloped by smoke that lasts for 1 minute. The area is considered Heavily Obscured and any creatures in the area are Blinded.

Minuteman.name: Minuteman
Minuteman.description: The basic Minuteman is little more than a settler given a laser musket. They will fight to defend their homes, but may not be reliable if needed to take up arms against a greater threat.
loot: x1 cloth armor (1d8 levels of Decay)
x1 laser musket (1d8+1 levels of Decay)
x1 flare gun (1d6 levels of Decay)
traits: Volunteer Fighter. The first time a Minuteman takes damage to their HP, they must make a DC 10 Endurance check. If they fail, they gain the Frightened condition for 1 round and must Flee.
actions: 5 AP Laser Musket. Ranged weapon attack: +2 to hit, range 50/80 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/x2 + Burning. Hit: 10 (2d8+2) laser damage. Can be charged with +3 AP for a bonus damage die and double modifier.

4 AP Flare Gun. Ranged weapon attack: +3 to hit, range 25/70 ft., one target. Crit chance 20/1d4. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) fire damage. Reload every attack (4 AP). If this attack damages a target’s HP, the target gains the Burning condition.

Minuteman Veteran.name: Minuteman Veteran
Minuteman Veteran.description: Minuteman Veterans have been fighting the good fight for a while, and are willing to lay down their life to protect others. Working with other Minutemen, they can call down artillery strikes on their enemies.
loot: x1 leather armor (1d4 levels of Decay)
